Text

[Mr.]362-mr. and [Mrs. Dursley]95-mrs. dursley , of number four , [Privet Drive]1-privet drive , were proud to say that [they]363-they were perfectly normal , thank [you]364-you very much . [They]363-they were the last people [you]364-you ’d expect to be involved in anything strange or mysterious , because [they]363-they just did n’t hold with such nonsense . [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley was [the director of [a firm called Grunnings , which made drills]366-a firm called grunnings , which made drills]365-the director of a firm called grunnings , which made drills . [He]96-mr. dursley was [a big , beefy man with hardly any neck]367-a big , beefy man with hardly any neck , although [he]96-mr. dursley did have a very large mustache . [Mrs. Dursley]95-mrs. dursley was thin and blonde and had nearly twice the usual amount of neck , which came in very useful as [she]95-mrs. dursley spent so much of [her]95-mrs. dursley time craning over garden fences , spying on [the neighbors]368-the neighbors . [The Dursleys]97-the dursleys had [a small son]369-a small son called [Dudley]98-dudley and in [their]97-the dursleys opinion there was [no finer boy]370-no finer boy anywhere . [The Dursleys]97-the dursleys had everything [they]97-the dursleys wanted , but [they]97-the dursleys also had a secret , and [their]97-the dursleys greatest fear was that [somebody]371-somebody would discover it . [They]97-the dursleys did n’t think [they]97-the dursleys could bear it if [anyone]372-anyone found out about [the Potters]99-the potters . [Mrs. Potter]100-mrs. potter was [[Mrs. Dursley]95-mrs. dursley ’s sister]373-mrs. dursley ’s sister , but [they]374-they had n’t met for several years ; in fact , [Mrs. Dursley]95-mrs. dursley pretended [she]95-mrs. dursley did n’t have [a sister]375-a sister , because [[her]95-mrs. dursley sister]376-her sister and [[her]95-mrs. dursley good for nothing husband]377-her good for nothing husband were as unDursleyish as it was possible to be . [The Dursleys]97-the dursleys shuddered to think what [the neighbors]368-the neighbors would say if [the Potters]99-the potters arrived in [the street]379-the street . [The Dursleys]97-the dursleys knew that [the Potters]380-the potters had [a small son]369-a small son , too , but [they]97-the dursleys had never even seen [him]369-a small son . [This boy]382-this boy was another good reason for keeping [the Potters]99-the potters away ; [they]97-the dursleys did n’t want [Dudley]98-dudley mixing with [a child]383-a child like that . When [Mr.]384-mr. and [Mrs. Dursley]95-mrs. dursley woke up on the dull , gray Tuesday [our]385-our story starts , there was nothing about the cloudy sky outside to suggest that strange and mysterious things would soon be happening all over [the country]386-the country . [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley hummed as [he]96-mr. dursley picked out [his]96-mr. dursley most boring tie for work , and [Mrs. Dursley]95-mrs. dursley gossiped away happily as [she]95-mrs. dursley wrestled a screaming [Dudley]98-dudley into [his]98-dudley high chair . [None of [them]97-the dursleys]387-none of them noticed a large , tawny owl flutter past the window . At half past eight , [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley picked up [his]96-mr. dursley briefcase , pecked [Mrs. Dursley]95-mrs. dursley on the cheek , and tried to kiss [Dudley]98-dudley good bye but missed , because [Dudley]98-dudley was now having a tantrum and throwing [his]98-dudley cereal at the walls . “ [Little tyke]101-little tyke , ”[96-mr. dursley] chortled [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley as [he]96-mr. dursley left [the house]388-the house . [He]96-mr. dursley got into [[his]96-mr. dursley car]389-his car and backed out of [number four ’s drive]390-number four ’s drive . It was on the corner of [the street]379-the street that [he]96-mr. dursley noticed the first sign of something peculiar — a cat reading a map . For a second , [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley did n’t realize what [he]96-mr. dursley had seen — then [he]96-mr. dursley jerked [his]96-mr. dursley head around to look again . There was a tabby cat standing on the corner of [Privet Drive]1-privet drive , but there was n’t a map in sight . What could [he]96-mr. dursley have been thinking of ? It must have been a trick of the light . [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley blinked and stared at the cat . [It]392-it stared back . As [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley drove around the corner and up [the road]393-the road , [he]96-mr. dursley watched the cat in [his]96-mr. dursley mirror . [It]392-it was now reading the sign that said [Privet Drive]1-privet drive — no , looking at the sign ; cats could n’t read maps or signs . [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley gave [himself]96-mr. dursley a little shake and put the cat out of [his]96-mr. dursley mind . As [he]96-mr. dursley drove toward [town]394-town [he]96-mr. dursley thought of nothing except a large order of drills [he]96-mr. dursley was hoping to get that day . But on [the edge of [town]394-town]395-the edge of town , drills were driven out of [his]96-mr. dursley mind by something else . As [he]96-mr. dursley sat in the usual morning traffic jam , [he]96-mr. dursley could n’t help noticing that there seemed to be a lot of [strangely dressed people]397-strangely dressed people about . [People in cloaks]398-people in cloaks . [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley could n’t bear [people who dressed in funny clothes — the getups [you]400-you saw on [young people]401-young people]399-people who dressed in funny clothes — the getups you saw on young people ! [He]96-mr. dursley supposed this was some stupid new fashion . [He]96-mr. dursley drummed [his]96-mr. dursley fingers on the steering wheel and [his]96-mr. dursley eyes fell on a huddle of [these weirdos standing quite close by]402-these weirdos standing quite close by . [They]402-these weirdos standing quite close by were whispering excitedly together . [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley was enraged to see that [a couple of [them]402-these weirdos standing quite close by]403-a couple of them were n’t young at all ; why , [that man]404-that man had to be older than [he]404-that man was , and wearing an emerald green cloak ! The nerve of [him]96-mr. dursley ! But then it struck [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley that this was probably some silly stunt — [these people]405-these people were obviously collecting for something … yes , that would be it . The traffic moved on and a few minutes later , [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley arrived in [the Grunnings parking lot]406-the grunnings parking lot , [his]96-mr. dursley mind back on drills . [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley always sat with [his]96-mr. dursley back to the window in [[his]96-mr. dursley office]407-his office on [the ninth floor]408-the ninth floor . If [he]96-mr. dursley had n’t , [he]96-mr. dursley might have found it harder to concentrate on drills that morning . [He]96-mr. dursley did n’t see the owls swooping past in broad daylight , though [people down in [the street]379-the street]409-people down in the street did ; [they]409-people down in the street pointed and gazed open - mouthed as owl after owl sped overhead . [Most of [them]409-people down in the street]411-most of them had never seen an owl even at nighttime . [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley , however , had a perfectly normal , owl free morning . [He]96-mr. dursley yelled at [five different people]412-five different people . [He]96-mr. dursley made several important telephone calls and shouted a bit more . [He]96-mr. dursley was in a very good mood until lunchtime , when [he]96-mr. dursley thought [he]96-mr. dursley ’d stretch [his]96-mr. dursley legs and walk across [the road]393-the road to buy [himself]96-mr. dursley a bun from [the bakery]414-the bakery . [He]96-mr. dursley ’d forgotten all about [the people in [cloaks]416-cloaks]415-the people in cloaks until [he]96-mr. dursley passed [a group of [them]415-the people in cloaks next to [the baker]418-the baker ’s]417-a group of them next to the baker ’s . [He]96-mr. dursley eyed [them]415-the people in cloaks angrily as [he]96-mr. dursley passed . [He]96-mr. dursley did n’t know why , but [they]415-the people in cloaks made [him]96-mr. dursley uneasy . [This bunch]419-this bunch were whispering excitedly , too , and [he]96-mr. dursley could n’t see a single collecting tin . [It]420-it was on [his]96-mr. dursley way back past [them]415-the people in cloaks , clutching a large doughnut in a bag , that [he]96-mr. dursley caught a few words of what [they]415-the people in cloaks were saying . “ [The Potters]99-the potters , that ’s right , that ’s what [I]415-the people in cloaks heard — ”[415-the people in cloaks] “ — yes , [[their]99-the potters son]2204-their son , [Harry]102-harry — ”[415-the people in cloaks] [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley stopped dead . Fear flooded [him]96-mr. dursley . [He]96-mr. dursley looked back at [the whisperers]421-the whisperers as if [he]96-mr. dursley wanted to say something to [them]421-the whisperers , but thought better of it . [He]96-mr. dursley dashed back across [the road]393-the road , hurried up to [[his]96-mr. dursley office]407-his office , snapped at [[his]96-mr. dursley secretary]424-his secretary not to disturb [him]96-mr. dursley , seized [his]96-mr. dursley telephone , and had almost finished dialing [his]96-mr. dursley home number when [he]96-mr. dursley changed [his]96-mr. dursley mind . [He]96-mr. dursley put the receiver back down and stroked [his]96-mr. dursley mustache , thinking … no , [he]96-mr. dursley was being stupid . [Potter]102-harry was n’t such an unusual name . [He]96-mr. dursley was sure there were [lots of people called [Potter]102-harry who had [a son]426-a son called [Harry]102-harry]425-lots of people called potter who had a son called harry . Come to think of it , [he]96-mr. dursley was n’t even sure [[his]96-mr. dursley nephewwas]427-his nephewwas called [Harry]102-harry . [He]96-mr. dursley ’d never even seen [the boy]428-the boy . It might have been [Harvey]103-harvey . Or [Harold]102-harry . There was no point in worrying [Mrs. Dursley]95-mrs. dursley ; [she]95-mrs. dursley always got so upset at any mention of [[her]95-mrs. dursley sister]376-her sister . [He]96-mr. dursley did n’t blame [her]95-mrs. dursley — ifhe’d had [a sister like that]430-a sister like that … but all the same , [those people in cloaks]431-those people in cloaks … [He]96-mr. dursley found it a lot harder to concentrate on drills that afternoon and when [he]96-mr. dursley left [the building]432-the building at five o’clock , [he]96-mr. dursley was still so worried that [he]96-mr. dursley walked straight into [someone just outside the door]433-someone just outside the door . “ Sorry , ”[96-mr. dursley] [he]96-mr. dursley grunted , as [the tiny old man]434-the tiny old man stumbled and almost fell . It was a few seconds before [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley realized that [the man]435-the man was wearing a violet cloak . [He]435-the man did n’t seem at all upset at being almost knocked to the ground . On the contrary , [his]435-the man face split into a wide smile and [he]435-the man said in a squeaky voice that made [passersby]436-passersby stare , “ Do n’t be sorry , [[my]435-the man dear sir]2205-my dear sir , for nothing could upset [me]435-the man today ! Rejoice , for [You]2205-my dear sir - Know - Who has gone at last ! [Even Muggles like [yourself]2205-my dear sir]2206-even muggles like yourself should be celebrating , this happy , happy day ! ”[435-the man] And [the old man]437-the old man hugged [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley around the middle and walked off . [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley stood rooted to the spot . [He]96-mr. dursley had been hugged by [a complete stranger]438-a complete stranger . [He]96-mr. dursley also thought [he]96-mr. dursley had been called [a Muggle]439-a muggle , whatever that was . [He]96-mr. dursley was rattled . [He]96-mr. dursley hurried to [[his]96-mr. dursley car]389-his car and set off for [home]441-home , hoping [he]96-mr. dursley was imagining things , which [he]96-mr. dursley had never hoped before , because [he]96-mr. dursley did n’t approve of imagination . As [he]96-mr. dursley pulled into [the driveway of number four]442-the driveway of number four , the first thing [he]96-mr. dursley saw — and it did n’t improve [his]96-mr. dursley mood — was the tabby cat [he]96-mr. dursley ’d spotted that morning . It was now sitting on [his]96-mr. dursley garden wall . [He]96-mr. dursley was sure it was the same one ; it had the same markings around its eyes . “ Shoo ! ”[96-mr. dursley] said [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley loudly . The cat did n’t move . It just gave [him]96-mr. dursley a stern look . Was this normal cat behavior ? [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley wondered . Trying to pull [himself]96-mr. dursley together , [he]96-mr. dursley let [himself]96-mr. dursley into [the house]388-the house . [He]96-mr. dursley was still determined not to mention anything to [[his]96-mr. dursley wife]444-his wife . [Mrs. Dursley]95-mrs. dursley had had a nice , normal day . [She]95-mrs. dursley told [him]96-mr. dursley over dinner all about [Mrs. Next Door]104-mrs. next door ’s problems with [[her]95-mrs. dursley daughter]445-her daughter and how [Dudley]98-dudley had learned a new word ( “ Wo n’t ! ”[95-mrs. dursley] ) . [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley tried to act normally . When [Dudley]98-dudley had been put to bed , [he]96-mr. dursley went into [the living room]446-the living room in time to catch the last report on the evening news : “ And finally , [bird watchers]2207-bird watchers everywhere have reported that [the nation]2208-the nation ’s owls have been behaving very unusually today . Although owls normally hunt at night and are hardly ever seen in daylight , there have been hundreds of sightings of these birds flying in every direction since sunrise . [Experts]2209-experts are unable to explain why the owls have suddenly changed [their]2207-bird watchers sleeping pattern . ”[96-mr. dursley] [The newscaster]447-the newscaster allowed [himself]96-mr. dursley a grin . “ Most mysterious . And now , over to [Jim McGuffin]105-jim mcguffin with the weather . Going to be any more showers of owls tonight , [Jim]105-jim mcguffin ? ”[96-mr. dursley] “ Well , [Ted]106-terry , ”[448-the weatherman] said [the weatherman]448-the weatherman , “ [I]448-the weatherman do n’t know about that , but it ’s not only the owls that have been acting oddly today . [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley might have been drifting into an uneasy sleep , but the cat on the wall outside was showing no sign of sleepiness . It was sitting as still as a statue , its eyes fixed unblinkingly on [the far corner of [Privet Drive]1-privet drive]461-the far corner of privet drive . It did n’t so much as quiver when a car door slammed on [the next street]462-the next street , nor when two owls swooped overhead . In fact , it was nearly midnight before the cat moved at all . [A man]463-a man appeared on the corner the cat had been watching , appeared so suddenly and silently [you]464-you ’d have thought [he]463-a man ’d just popped out of the ground . The cat ’s tail twitched and its eyes narrowed . Nothing like [this man]465-this man had ever been seen on [Privet Drive]1-privet drive . [He]465-this man was tall , thin , and very old , judging by the silver of [his]465-this man hair and beard , which were both long enough to tuck into [his]465-this man belt . [He]465-this man was wearing long robes , a purple cloak that swept the ground , and high heeled , buckled boots . [His]465-this man blue eyes were light , bright , and sparkling behind half moon spectacles and [his]465-this man nose was very long and crooked , as though it had been broken at least twice . [This man]465-this man ’s name was [Albus Dumbledore]110-dumbledore . [He]110-dumbledore clicked it again — the next lamp flickered into darkness . Nearly ten years had passed since [the Dursleys]97-the dursleys had woken up to find [[their]97-the dursleys nephew]503-their nephew on the front step , but [Privet Drive]1-privet drive had hardly changed at all . The sun rose on [the same tidy front gardens]504-the same tidy front gardens and lit up the brass number four on the [Dursleys]97-the dursleys ’ front door ; it crept into [[their]97-the dursleys living room]505-their living room , which was almost exactly the same as it had been on the night when [Mr. Dursley]96-mr. dursley had seen that fateful news report about the owls . Only the photographs on the mantelpiece really showed how much time had passed . Ten years ago , there had been lots of pictures of what looked like a large pink beach ball wearing different colored bonnets — but [Dudley Dursley]98-dudley was no longer [a baby]506-a baby , and now the photographs showed [a large blond boy]507-a large blond boy riding [his]507-a large blond boy first bicycle , on a carousel at the fair , playing a computer game with [[his]507-a large blond boy father]508-his father , being hugged and kissed by [hismother]509-hismother . [The room]510-the room held no sign at all that [another boy]511-another boy lived in [the house]388-the house , too . Yet [Harry Potter]102-harry was still there , asleep at the moment , but not for long . [[His]102-harry aunt]2244-his aunt was back outside the door . “ Are [you]102-harry up yet ? ”[2244-his aunt] [she]2244-his aunt demanded . “ Nearly , ”[102-harry] said [Harry]102-harry . “ Well , get a move on , [I]102-harry want [you]2244-his aunt to look after the bacon . [Harry]102-harry got slowly out of bed and started looking for socks . [He]102-harry found a pair under [his]102-harry bed and , after pulling a spider off one of them , put them on . [[His]102-harry aunt]2244-his aunt and [uncle]2245-uncle had n’t been able to think of anything else to do with [him]102-harry , but before [they]97-the dursleys ’d left , [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon had taken [Harry]102-harry aside . “ [I]123-uncle vernon ’m warning [you]102-harry , ”[123-uncle vernon] [he]123-uncle vernon had said , putting [his]123-uncle vernon large purple face right up close to [Harry]102-harry ’s , “ [I]123-uncle vernon ’m warning [you]102-harry now , [boy]2286-boy — any funny business , anything at all — and [you]102-harry ’ll be in that cupboard from now until Christmas . ”[123-uncle vernon] “ [I]102-harry ’m not going to do anything , ”[102-harry] said [Harry]102-harry , “ honestly … ”[102-harry] But [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon did n’t believe [him]102-harry . [No one]2238-no one ever did . [Aunt Petunia]107-aunt petunia had decided it must have shrunk in the wash and , to [his]102-harry great relief , [Harry]102-harry was n’t punished . On the other hand , [he]102-harry ’d gotten into terrible trouble for being found on the roof of [the school kitchens]558-the school kitchens . [Harry]102-harry supposed that the wind must have caught [him]102-harry in mid - jump . But today , nothing was going to go wrong . [Harry]102-harry had the best morning [he]102-harry ’d had in a long time . [It]580-the reptile house was cool and dark in there , with lit windows all along the walls . Behind the glass , all sorts of lizards and snakes were crawling and slithering over bits of wood and stone . [Dudley]98-dudley and [Piers]135-piers wanted to see huge , poisonous cobras and thick , man crushing pythons . [Dudley]98-dudley quickly found the largest snake in [the place]450-the place . It could have wrapped its body twice around [[Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon ’s car]582-uncle vernon ’s car and crushed it into a trash can — but at the moment it did n’t look in the mood . In fact , it was fast asleep . When [September]141-september came [he]102-harry would be going off to [secondary school]644-secondary school and , for the first time in [his]102-harry life , [he]102-harry would n’t be with [Dudley]98-dudley . [Aunt Petunia]107-aunt petunia burst into tears and said [she]107-aunt petunia could n’t believe it was [her]107-aunt petunia Ickle [Dudleykins]143-dudleykins , [he]98-dudley looked so handsome and grown up . [He]102-harry thought two of [his]102-harry ribs might already have cracked from trying not to laugh . * * * There was a horrible smell in [the kitchen]514-the kitchen the next morning when [Harry]102-harry went in for breakfast . It seemed to be coming from a large metal tub in the sink . [He]102-harry went to have a look . [The tub]656-the tub was full of what looked like dirty rags swimming in gray water . “ What ’s this ? ”[102-harry] [he]102-harry asked [Aunt Petunia]107-aunt petunia . [Her]107-aunt petunia lips tightened as they always did if [he]102-harry dared to ask a question . “ [Your]102-harry new school uniform , ”[107-aunt petunia] [she]107-aunt petunia said . [He]102-harry sat down at the table and tried not to think about how [he]102-harry was going to look on [his]102-harry first day at [Stonewall High]10-stonewall high — like [he]102-harry was wearing bits of old elephant skin , probably . [Dudley]98-dudley and [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon came in , both with wrinkled noses because of the smell from [Harry]102-harry ’s new uniform . [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon opened [his]123-uncle vernon newspaper as usual and [Dudley]98-dudley banged [his]98-dudley Smelting stick , which [he]98-dudley carried everywhere , on the table . [They]657-they heard the click of the mail slot and flop of letters on the doormat . “ Get the mail , [Dudley]98-dudley , ”[123-uncle vernon] said [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon from behind [his]123-uncle vernon paper . “ Make [Harry]102-harry get it . ”[123-uncle vernon] “ Get the mail , [Harry]102-harry . ”[657-they] “ Make [Dudley]98-dudley get it . ”[123-uncle vernon] “ Poke [him]98-dudley with [your]98-dudley Smelting stick , [Dudley]98-dudley . ”[102-harry] [Harry]102-harry dodged the Smelting stick and went to get the mail . Three things lay on the doormat : a postcard from [[Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon ’s sister]658-uncle vernon ’s sister [Marge]124-marge , who was vacationing on [the Isle of Wight]659-the isle of wight , a brown envelope that looked like a bill , and — a letter for [Harry]102-harry . [Harry]102-harry picked it up and stared at it , [his]102-harry heart twanging like a giant elastic band . [No one]2238-no one , ever , in [his]102-harry whole life , had written to [him]102-harry . Who would ? [He]102-harry had [no friends]661-no friends , [no other relatives]662-no other relatives — [he]102-harry did n’t belong to [the library]663-the library , so [he]102-harry ’d never even got rude notes asking for books back . Yet here it was , a letter , addressed so plainly there could be no mistake : [Mr. H. Potter]144-mr. h. potter [The Cupboard under the Stairs 4 Privet Drive Little Whinging Surrey]664-the cupboard under the stairs 4 privet drive little whinging surrey The envelope was thick and heavy , made of yellowish parchment , and the address was written in emerald green ink . There was no stamp . After what seemed like hours [they]752-them reached [the rock]749-the rock , where [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon , slipping and sliding , led the way to [the broken down house]757-the broken down house . The inside was horrible ; [it]758-it smelled strongly of seaweed , the wind whistled through the gaps in the wooden walls , and the fireplace was damp and empty . There were only [two rooms]759-two rooms . [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon ’s rations turned out to be a bag of chips each and four bananas . [He]123-uncle vernon tried to start a fire but the empty chip bags just smoked and shriveled up . “ Could do with some of those letters now , eh ? ”[123-uncle vernon] [he]123-uncle vernon said cheerfully . [He]123-uncle vernon was in a very good mood . Obviously [he]123-uncle vernon thought [nobody]632-nobody stood a chance of reaching [them]761-them here in a storm to deliver mail . [Harry]102-harry privately agreed , though the thought did n’t cheer [him]123-uncle vernon up at all . As night fell , the promised storm blew up around [them]752-them . Spray from the high waves splattered the walls of [the hut]762-the hut and a fierce wind rattled the filthy windows . [Aunt Petunia]107-aunt petunia found a few moldy blankets in [the second room]763-the second room and made up a bed for [Dudley]98-dudley on the moth eaten sofa . [She]107-aunt petunia and [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon went off to the lumpy bed next door , and [Harry]102-harry was left to find the softest bit of floor [he]102-harry could and to curl up under the thinnest , most ragged blanket . The storm raged more and more ferociously as the night went on . [Harry]102-harry could n’t sleep . [He]102-harry shivered and turned over , trying to get comfortable , [his]102-harry stomach rumbling with hunger . [Dudley]98-dudley ’s snores were drowned by the low rolls of thunder that started near midnight . The lighted dial of [Dudley]98-dudley ’s watch , which was dangling over the edge of the sofa on [his]123-uncle vernon fat wrist , told [Harry]102-harry [he]102-harry ’d be eleven in ten minutes ’ time . [He]102-harry lay and watched [his]102-harry birthday tick nearer , wondering if [the Dursleys]97-the dursleys would remember at all , wondering where [the letter writer]764-the letter writer was now . Five minutes to go . [Harry]102-harry heard something creak outside . [He]102-harry hoped the roof was n’t going to fall in , although [he]102-harry might be warmer if it did . Four minutes to go . Maybe [the house in [Privet Drive]1-privet drive]765-the house in privet drive would be so full of letters when [they]97-the dursleys got back that [he]102-harry ’d be able to steal one somehow . Three minutes to go . Was that [the sea]766-the sea , slapping hard on the rock like that ? And ( two minutes to go ) what was that funny crunching noise ? Was the rock crumbling into [the sea]766-the sea ? One minute to go and [he]102-harry ’d be eleven . Thirty seconds … twenty … ten … nine — maybe [he]102-harry ’d wake [Dudley]98-dudley up , just to annoy [him]98-dudley — three … two … one … BOOM . [The whole shack]768-the whole shack shivered and [Harry]102-harry sat bolt upright , staring at the door . [Someone]700-someone was outside , knocking to come in .

BOOM . [They]97-the dursleys knocked again . [Dudley]98-dudley jerked awake . “Where ’s the cannon ? ”[98-dudley] [he]98-dudley said stupidly . There was a crash behind [them]97-the dursleys and [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon came skidding into [the room]510-the room . Then — SMASH ! The door was hit with such force that it swung clean off its hinges and with a deafening crash landed flat on the floor . [A giant of a man]771-a giant of a man was standing in the doorway . [His]771-a giant of a man face was almost completely hidden by a long , shaggy mane of hair and a wild , tangled beard , but [you]772-you could make out [his]771-a giant of a man eyes , glinting like black beetles under all the hair . [Harry]102-harry woke early the next morning . Something really extraordinary had to be inside [this top security vault]2542-this top security vault , [Harry]102-harry was sure , and [he]102-harry leaned forward eagerly , expecting to see fabulous jewels at the very least — but at first [he]102-harry thought it was empty . [He]102-harry was n’t sure [he]102-harry liked [Mr. Ollivander]185-mr. ollivander too much . The late afternoon sun hung low in the sky as [Harry]102-harry and [Hagrid]119-hagrid made [their]970-they way back down [Diagon Alley]29-diagon alley , back through the wall , back through [the Leaky Cauldron]36-the leaky cauldron , now empty . [Harry]102-harry did n’t speak at all as [they]970-they walked down [the road]393-the road ; [he]102-harry did n’t even notice how much [people]2211-people were gawking at [them]970-they on [the Underground]2460-the underground , laden as [they]970-they were with all [their]970-they funny shaped packages , with the snowy owl asleep in its cage on [Harry]102-harry ’s lap . Up another escalator , out into [Paddington station]2590-paddington station ; [Harry]102-harry only realized where [they]970-they were when [Hagrid]119-hagrid tapped [him]102-harry on the shoulder . “[958-the wizard] Got time fer a bite to eat before [yer]971-yer train leaves , ” [he]119-hagrid said . [He]119-hagrid bought [Harry]102-harry a hamburger and [they]970-they sat down on plastic seats to eat them . [Harry]102-harry kept looking around . Everything looked so strange , somehow . “[958-the wizard] [You]971-yer all right , [Harry]102-harry ? [Yer]971-yer very quiet , ” said [Hagrid]119-hagrid . [Harry]102-harry was n’t sure [he]102-harry could explain . [Harry]102-harry ’s last month with [the Dursleys]97-the dursleys was n’t fun . True , [Dudley]98-dudley was now so scared of [Harry]102-harry [he]98-dudley would n’t stay in [the same room]2595-the same room , while [Aunt Petunia]107-aunt petunia and [Uncle Vernon]123-uncle vernon did n’t shut [Harry]102-harry in [[his]102-harry cupboard]563-his cupboard , force [him]102-harry to do anything , or shout at [him]102-harry — in fact , [they]97-the dursleys did n’t speak to [him]102-harry at all . Half terrified , half furious , [they]97-the dursleys acted as though any chair with [Harry]102-harry in [it]2597-it were empty . Although this was an improvement in many ways , it did become a bit depressing after a while . [Harry]102-harry kept to [[his]102-harry room]692-his room , with [his]102-harry new owl for company . [He]102-harry had decided to call [her]2599-her [Hedwig]188-hedwig , a name [he]102-harry had found inA History of Magic . [His]102-harry school books were very interesting . [He]102-harry lay on [his]102-harry bed reading late into the night , [Hedwig]188-hedwig swooping in and out of the open window as [she]2599-her pleased . Mainly to avoid all the staring eyes , [Harry]102-harry looked upward and saw a velvety black ceiling dotted with stars . It was colder here than up in [the main castle]1322-the main castle , and would have been quite creepy enough without the pickled animals floating in glass jars all around the walls . [Snape]258-snape , like [Flitwick]272-professor flitwick , started the class by taking the roll call , and like [Flitwick]272-professor flitwick , [he]258-snape paused at [Harry]102-harry ’s name . “ Ah , Yes , ”[258-snape] [he]258-snape said softly , “ [Harry Potter]102-harry . [His]258-snape eyes were black like [Hagrid]119-hagrid ’s , but they had none of [Hagrid]119-hagrid ’s warmth . They were cold and empty and made [you]1326-you think of [dark tunnels]1327-dark tunnels . “ [You]1326-you are here to learn the subtle science and exact art of potionmaking , ”[258-snape] [he]258-snape began . [He]258-snape spoke in barely more than a whisper , but [they]1328-they caught every word — like [Professor McGonagall]111-professor mcgonagall , [Snape]258-snape had the gift of keeping [a class]1329-a class silent without effort . “ As there is little foolish wand waving [here]2221-here , many of [you]1326-you will hardly believe this is magic . [I]258-snape do n’t expect [you]1326-you will really understand the beauty of the softly simmering cauldron with its shimmering fumes , the delicate power of liquids that creep through human veins , bewitching the mind , ensnaring the senses … [I]258-snape can teach [you]1326-you how to bottle fame , brew glory , even stopper death — if [you]1326-you are n’t as big a bunch of dunderheads as [I]258-snape usually have to teach . ”[258-snape] More silence followed this little speech . [Harry]102-harry and [Ron]195-ron exchanged looks with raised eyebrows . Look , [you]196-neville hold it tight like this and if it turns red — oh … ”[196-neville] [His]196-neville face fell , because the Remembrall had suddenly glowed scarlet , “ … [you]196-neville ’ve forgotten something … ”[196-neville] [Neville]196-neville was trying to remember what [he]196-neville ’d forgotten when [Draco Malfoy]221-malfoy , who was passing the Gryffindor table , snatched the Remembrall out of [his]196-neville hand . At three thirty that afternoon , [Harry]102-harry , [Ron]195-ron , and [the other Gryffindors]1386-the other gryffindors hurried down the front steps onto [the grounds]1243-the grounds for [their]1379-their first flying lesson . It was a clear , breezy day , and the grass rippled under [their]1379-their feet as [they]1379-their marched down [the sloping lawns]1388-the sloping lawns toward a smooth , flat lawn on [the opposite side of [the grounds]1243-the grounds]1389-the opposite side of the grounds to [the forbidden forest]1346-the forbidden forest , whose trees were swaying darkly in the distance . [The Slytherins]254-the slytherins were already there , and so were twenty broomsticks lying in neat lines on the ground . [Harry]102-harry had heard [Fred]193-fred and [George Weasley]194-george complain about the school brooms , saying that some of them started to vibrate if [you]1392-you flew too high , or always flew slightly to the left . [[Their]1379-their teacher]1393-their teacher , [Madam Hooch]260-madam hooch , arrived . [She]260-madam hooch had short , gray hair , and yellow eyes like a hawk . “ Well , what are [you]1379-their all waiting for ? ”[260-madam hooch] [she]260-madam hooch barked . “ [Everyone]2222-everyone stand by a broomstick . Come on , hurry up . ”[102-harry] [Harry]102-harry glanced down at [his]102-harry broom . It was old and some of the twigs stuck out at odd angles . “ Stick out [your]1392-you right hand over [your]1392-you broom , ”[260-madam hooch] called [Madam Hooch]260-madam hooch at the front , “ and say ‘ Up ! ’ ”[260-madam hooch] “ UP ! ”[2222-everyone] [everyone]2222-everyone shouted . [Harry]102-harry ’s broom jumped into [his]102-harry hand at once , but it was one of the few that did . [Hermione Granger]216-hermione ’s had simply rolled over on the ground , and [Neville]196-neville ’s had n’t moved at all . Perhaps brooms , like horses , could tell when [you]1392-you were afraid , thought [Harry]102-harry ; there was a quaver in [Neville]196-neville ’s voice that said only too clearly that [he]196-neville wanted to keep [his]196-neville feet on the ground . [Madam Hooch]260-madam hooch then showed [them]1395-their how to mount [their]1395-their brooms without sliding off the end , and walked up and down the rows correcting [their]1395-their grips . [Harry]102-harry and [Ron]195-ron were delighted when [she]260-madam hooch told [Malfoy]221-malfoy [he]221-malfoy ’d been doing it wrong for years . “ Now , when [I]260-madam hooch blow [my]260-madam hooch whistle , [you]1395-their kick off from the ground , hard , ”[260-madam hooch] said [Madam Hooch]260-madam hooch . “ Keep [your]1395-their brooms steady , rise a few feet , and then come straight back down by leaning forward slightly . On [my]260-madam hooch whistle — three — two — ”[260-madam hooch] But [Neville]196-neville , nervous and jumpy and frightened of being left on the ground , pushed off hard before the whistle had touched [Madam Hooch]260-madam hooch ’s lips . “ Come back , [boy]2286-boy ! ”[260-madam hooch] [she]260-madam hooch shouted , but [Neville]196-neville was rising straight up like a cork shot out of a bottle — twelve feet — twenty feet . [Harry]102-harry saw [his]196-neville scared white face look down at the ground falling away , saw [him]196-neville gasp , slip sideways off the broom and — WHAM — a thud and a nasty crack and [Neville]196-neville lay facedown on the grass in a heap . [His]196-neville broomstick was still rising higher and higher , and started to drift lazily toward [the Forbidden Forest]65-the forbidden forest and out of sight . [Madam Hooch]260-madam hooch was bending over [Neville]196-neville , [her]260-madam hooch face as white as [his]196-neville . “ Broken wrist , ”[260-madam hooch] [Harry]102-harry heard [her]260-madam hooch mutter . “ Come on , [boy]2286-boy — it ’s all right , up [you]2286-boy get . ”[260-madam hooch] [She]260-madam hooch turned to [the rest of [the class]1301-the class]1396-the rest of the class . “ None of [you]2286-boy is to move while [I]260-madam hooch take [this boy]382-this boy to [the hospital wing]2906-the hospital wing ! [Everyone]2222-everyone stopped talking to watch . [He]221-malfoy had n’t been lying , hecould fly well . Blood was pounding in [his]102-harry ears . [He]102-harry mounted the broom and kicked hard against the ground and up , up [he]102-harry soared ; air rushed through [his]102-harry hair , and [his]102-harry robes whipped out behind [him]102-harry and in a rush of fierce joy [he]102-harry realized [he]102-harry ’d found something [he]102-harry could do without being taught — this was easy , this waswonderful . [He]102-harry pulled [his]102-harry broomstick up a little to take it even higher , and heard screams and gasps of [girls back on the ground]1401-girls back on the ground and an admiring whoop from [Ron]195-ron . [Harry]102-harry knew , somehow , what to do . [He]102-harry leaned forward and grasped the broom tightly in both hands , and it shot toward [Malfay]277-malfay like a javelin . [Malfoy]221-malfoy only just got out of the way in time ; [Harry]102-harry made a sharp about face and held the broom steady . [A few people below]1402-a few people below were clapping . “ No [Crabbe]219-crabbe and [Goyle]220-goyle up here to save [your]221-malfoy neck , [Malfoy]221-malfoy , ”[102-harry] [Harry]102-harry called . [They]1465-they were looking straight into the eyes of a monstrous dog , a dog that filled the whole space between ceiling and floor . It had three heads . [Harry]102-harry had a lot of trouble keeping [his]102-harry mind on [his]102-harry lessons that day . [He]102-harry bolted [his]102-harry dinner that evening without noticing what [he]102-harry was eating , and then rushed [upstairs]455-upstairs with [Ron]195-ron to unwrap the Nimbus Two Thousand at last . “ Wow , ”[195-ron] [Ron]195-ron sighed , as the broomstick rolled onto [Harry]102-harry ’s bedspread . Even [Harry]102-harry , who knew nothing about the different brooms , thought it looked wonderful . Sleek and shiny , with a mahogany handle , it had a long tail of neat , straight twigs and Nimbus Two Thousand written in gold near the top . As seven o’clock drew nearer , [Harry]102-harry left [the castle]2806-the castle and set off in the dusk toward [the Quidditch field]2980-the quidditch field . [He]102-harry ’d never been inside [the stadium]1498-the stadium before . Hundreds of seats were raised in stands around [the field]1499-the field so that [the spectators]1500-the spectators were high enough to see what was going on . At either end of [the field]1499-the field were three golden poles with hoops on the end . They reminded [Harry]102-harry of the little plastic sticks [Muggle children]1502-muggle children blew bubbles through , except that they were fifty feet high . Too eager to fly again to wait for [Wood]281-wood , [Harry]102-harry mounted [his]102-harry broomstick and kicked off from the ground . What a feeling — [he]102-harry swooped in and out of the goal posts and then sped up and down [the field]1499-the field . The Nimbus Two Thousand turned wherever [he]102-harry wanted at [his]102-harry lightest touch . “ Hey , [Potter]102-harry , come down ! ”[281-wood] [Oliver Wood]281-wood had arrived . [He]281-wood was carrying a large wooden crate under [his]281-wood arm . Twelve feet tall , its skin was a dull , granite gray , [its]3053-it great lumpy body like a boulder with its small bald head perched on top like a coconut . [It]3053-it was holding a huge wooden club , which dragged along the floor because its arms were so long . [The troll]1524-the troll stopped next to a doorway and peered inside . Why are n’t [you]1533-you in [[your]1533-you dormitory]1534-your dormitory ? ” [Snape]285-snape gave [Harry]102-harry a swift , piercing look . [Harry]102-harry looked at the floor . [He]102-harry wished [Ron]195-ron would put [his]195-ron wand down . Then a small voice came out of the shadows . “[1533-you] Please , [Professor McGonagall]111-professor mcgonagall — [they]1535-they were looking for [me]0-i . ” “[1535-they] [Miss Granger]216-hermione ! ” [Hermione]216-hermione had managed to get to [her]216-hermione feet at last . “[1535-they] [I]0-i went looking for [the troll]1524-the troll because [I]0-i — [I]0-i thought [I]0-i could deal with it on [my]0-i own — [you]216-hermione know , because [I]0-i ’ve read all about [them]1535-they . ” [Ron]195-ron dropped [his]195-ron wand . As [they]1543-they entered November , the weather turned very cold . [The mountains around [the school]2389-the school]1547-the mountains around the school became icy gray and [the lake]2797-the lake like chilled steel . Every morning the ground was covered in frost . [Hagrid]119-hagrid could be seen from the upstairs windows defrosting broomsticks on [the Quidditch field]2980-the quidditch field , bundled up in a long moleskin overcoat , rabbit fur gloves , and enormous beaverskin boots . The Quidditch season had begun . On Saturday , [Harry]102-harry would be playing in [his]102-harry first match after weeks of training : [Gryffindor]224-gryffindor versus [Slytherin]286-seeker . If [Gryffindor]224-gryffindor won , [they]1543-they would move up into second place in the house championship . [Hardly anyone]1551-hardly anyone had seen [Harry]102-harry play because [Wood]281-wood had decided that , as [their]1543-they secret weapon , [Harry]102-harry should be kept , well , secret . But the news that [he]102-harry was playing [Seeker]286-seeker had leaked out somehow , and [Harry]102-harry did n’t know which was worse — [people]2211-people telling [him]102-harry [he]102-harry ’d be brilliant or [people]2211-people telling [him]102-harry [they]2211-people ’d be running around underneath [him]102-harry holding a mattress . It was really lucky that [Harry]102-harry now had [Hermione]216-hermione as [a friend]536-a friend . [He]102-harry did n’t know how [he]102-harry ’d have gotten through all [his]102-harry homework without [her]216-hermione , what with all the last minute Quidditch practice [Wood]281-wood was making [them]1543-they do . [She]216-hermione had also lent [himQuidditch]304-himquidditch Through the Ages , which turned out to be a very interesting read . [Harry]102-harry learned that there were seven hundred ways of committing a Quidditch foul and that all of them had happened during a World Cup match in 1473 ; that [Seekers]297-seekers were usually [the smallest and fastest players]1555-the smallest and fastest players , and that most serious Quidditch accidents seemed to happen to [them]297-seekers ; that although [people]2211-people rarely died playing [Quidditch]179-quidditch , [referees]1557-referees had been known to vanish and turn up months later in [the Sahara Desert]72-the sahara desert . [Hermione]216-hermione had become a bit more relaxed about breaking rules since [Harry]102-harry and [Ron]195-ron had saved [her]216-hermione from the mountain troll , and [she]216-hermione was much nicer for it . [Harry]102-harry saw it . In a great rush of excitement [he]102-harry dived downward after the streak of gold . [Slytherin Seeker Terence Higgs]286-seeker had seen it , too . Neck and neck [they]1592-they hurtled toward the Snitch all [the Chasers]2993-the chasers seemed to have forgotten what [they]2993-the chasers were supposed to be doing as [they]2993-the chasers hung in midair to watch . [Harry]102-harry was faster than [Higgs]286-seeker — [he]102-harry could see the little round ball , wings fluttering , darting up ahead — [he]102-harry put on an extra spurt of speed — WHAM ! A roar of rage echoed from [the Gryffindors]253-gryffindors below — [Marcus Flint]181-slytherin had blocked [Harry]102-harry on purpose , and [Harry]102-harry ’s broom spun off course , [Harry]102-harry holding on for dear life . “ Foul ! ”[253-gryffindors] screamed [the Gryffindors]253-gryffindors . [Madam Hooch]260-madam hooch spoke angrily to [Flint]181-slytherin and then ordered a free shot at the goal posts for [Gryffindor]307-gryffindor . But in all the confusion , of course , [the Golden Snitch]296-the snitch had disappeared from sight again . [His]102-harry broom gave a sudden , frightening lurch . For a split second , [he]102-harry thought [he]102-harry was going to fall . Christmas was coming . One morning in mid December , [Hogwarts]16-hogwarts woke to find itself covered in several feet of snow . [The lake]2797-the lake froze solid and [the Weasley twins]1216-the weasley twins were punished for bewitching several snowballs so that [they]1216-the weasley twins followed [Quirrell]172-quirrell around , bouncing off the back of [his]172-quirrell turban . [No one]2238-no one could wait for the holidays to start . [He]102-harry , [Ron]195-ron , and [Hermione]216-hermione had already agreed [they]1652-they ’d better not ask [Madam Pince]318-madam pince where [they]1652-they could find [Flamel]210-flamel . [They]1652-they were sure [she]1650-the librarian ’d be able to tell [them]1652-they , but [they]1652-they could n’t risk [Snape]258-snape hearing what [they]1652-they were up to . [Harry]102-harry waited outside in [the corridor]2732-the corridor to see if [the other two]489-the other two had found anything , but [he]102-harry was n’t very hopeful . What [they]1652-they really needed was a nice long search without [Madam Pince]318-madam pince breathing down [their]1652-they necks . Five minutes later , [Ron]195-ron and [Hermione]216-hermione joined [him]102-harry , shaking [their]1652-they heads . [They]1652-they went off to lunch . “ [You]102-harry will keep looking while [I]216-hermione ’m away , wo n’t [you]102-harry ? ”[216-hermione] said [Hermione]216-hermione . “ And send [me]216-hermione an owl if [you]102-harry find anything . ”[216-hermione] “ And [you]102-harry could ask [[your]102-harry parents]2273-your parents if [they]2273-your parents know who [Flamel]210-flamel is , ”[195-ron] said [Ron]195-ron . “ It ’d be safe to ask [them]2273-your parents . ”[195-ron] “ Very safe , as [they]2273-your parents ’re both [dentists]3139-dentists , ”[216-hermione] said [Hermione]216-hermione . Once the holidays had started , [Ron]195-ron and [Harry]102-harry were having too good a time to think much about [Flamel]210-flamel . [They]1652-they had [the dormitory]1493-the dormitory to [themselves]1652-they and [the common room]1474-the common room was far emptier than usual , so [they]1652-they were able to get the good armchairs by the fire . [They]1652-they sat by the hour eating anything [they]1652-they could spear on a toasting fork — bread , English muffins , marshmallows — and plotting ways of getting [Malfoy]221-malfoy expelled , which were fun to talk about even if [they]1652-they would n’t work . [Ron]195-ron also started teaching [Harry]102-harry wizard chess . This was exactly like Muggle chess except that the figures were alive , which made it a lot like directing [troops in battle]1657-troops in battle . [Ron]195-ron ’s set was very old and battered . Like everything else [he]195-ron owned , it had once belonged to [someone else in [[his]195-ron family]1115-his family]1658-someone else in his family — in this case , [[his]195-ron grandfather]1660-his grandfather . However , [old chessmen]1661-old chessmen were n’t a drawback at all . [Sendhim]319-sendhim , [we]1662-chessmen can afford to losehim . ”[1662-chessmen] On Christmas Eve , [Harry]102-harry went to bed looking forward to the next day for the food and the fun , but not expecting any presents at all . [Harry]102-harry had never in all [his]102-harry life had such a Christmas dinner . A hundred fat , roast turkeys ; mountains of roast and boiled potatoes ; platters of chipolatas ; tureens of buttered peas , silver boats of thick , rich gravy and cranberry sauce — and stacks of wizard crackers every few feet along the table . These fantastic party favors were nothing like the feeble Muggle ones [the Dursleys]97-the dursleys usually bought , with [their]97-the dursleys little plastic toys and [their]97-the dursleys flimsy paper hats inside . [Harry]102-harry pulled a wizard cracker with [Fred]193-fred and it did n’t just bang , it went off with a blast like a cannon and engulfed [them]2676-the twins all in a cloud of blue smoke , while from the inside exploded [a rear admiral]1670-a rear admiral ’s hat and several live , white mice . Up at [the High Table]56-the high table , [Dumbledore]120-dumbledore had swapped [his]120-dumbledore pointed wizard ’s hat for a flowered bonnet , and was chuckling merrily at a jokeProfessor [Flitwick]272-professor flitwick had just read [him]120-dumbledore . Flaming Christmas puddings followed the turkey . [Percy]192-percy nearly broke [his]192-percy teeth on a silver sickle embedded in [his]192-percy slice . [Harry]102-harry watched [Hagrid]119-hagrid getting redder and redder in the face as [he]102-harry called for more wine , finally kissing [Professor McGonagall]111-professor mcgonagall on the cheek , who , to [Harry]102-harry ’s amazement , giggled and blushed , [her]111-professor mcgonagall top hat lopsided . When [Harry]102-harry finally left the table , [he]102-harry was laden down with a stack of things out of the crackers , including a pack of nonexplodable , luminous balloons , a Grow - Your - Own - Warts kit , and [his]102-harry own new wizard chess set . [The white mice]1671-the white mice had disappeared and [Harry]102-harry had a nasty feeling [they]1671-the white mice were going to end up as [Mrs. Norris]267-mrs. norris ’s Christmas dinner . [Harry]102-harry and [the Weasleys]201-the weasleys spent a happy afternoon having a furious snowball fight on [the grounds]1243-the grounds . Then , cold , wet , and gasping for breath , [they]1673-they returned to the fire in [the Gryffindor common room]2886-the gryffindor common room , where [Harry]102-harry broke in [his]102-harry new chess set by losing spectacularly to [Ron]195-ron . [He]102-harry suspected [he]102-harry would n’t have lost so badly if [Percy]192-percy had n’t tried to help [him]102-harry so much . After a meal of turkey sandwiches , crumpets , trifle , and Christmas cake , [everyone]2222-everyone felt too full and sleepy to do much before bed except sit and watch [Percy]192-percy chase [Fred]193-fred and [George]194-george all over [Gryffindor tower]57-gryffindor tower because [they]1673-they ’d stolen [his]102-harry prefect badge . It had been [Harry]102-harry ’s best Christmas day ever . Yet something had been nagging at the back of [his]102-harry mind all day . Not until [he]102-harry climbed into bed was [he]102-harry free to think about it : the Invisibility Cloak and whoever had sent it . [Ron]195-ron , full of turkey and cake and with nothing mysterious to bother [him]195-ron , fell asleep almost as soon as [he]195-ron ’d drawn the curtains of [his]195-ron four poster . [Harry]102-harry leaned over the side of [his]102-harry own bed and pulled the cloak out from under it . [[His]102-harry father]508-his father ’s … this had been [[his]102-harry father]508-his father ’s . [He]102-harry let the material flow over [his]102-harry hands , smoother than silk , light as air . Use it well , the note had said . [He]102-harry had to try it , now . [He]102-harry slipped out of bed and wrapped the cloak around [himself]102-harry . Looking down at [his]102-harry legs , [he]102-harry saw only moonlight and shadows . It was a very funny feeling . Use it well . Suddenly , [Harry]102-harry felt wide - awake . [The whole of [Hogwarts]16-hogwarts]1678-the whole of hogwarts was open to [him]102-harry in this cloak . Excitement flooded through [him]102-harry as [he]102-harry stood there in the dark and silence . [He]102-harry could go anywhere in this , anywhere , and [Filch]266-filch would never know . [Ron]195-ron grunted in [his]195-ron sleep . Should [Harry]102-harry wake [him]195-ron ? Something held [him]102-harry back — [[his]102-harry father]508-his father ’s cloak — [he]102-harry felt that this time — the first time — [he]102-harry wanted to use it alone . [He]102-harry crept out of [the dormitory]1493-the dormitory , down the stairs , across [the common room]1474-the common room , and climbed through the portrait hole . “ Who ’s there ? ”[1438-the fat lady] squawked [the Fat Lady]1438-the fat lady . [Harry]102-harry said nothing . [He]102-harry walked quickly down [the corridor]2732-the corridor . Where should [he]102-harry go ? [He]102-harry stopped , [his]102-harry heart racing , and thought . And then it came to [him]102-harry . [The Restricted Section in [the library]663-the library]1684-the restricted section in the library . [He]102-harry ’d be able to read as long as [he]102-harry liked , as long as it took to find out who [Flamel]210-flamel was . [He]102-harry set off , drawing the Invisibility Cloak tight around [him]102-harry as [he]102-harry walked . [The library]663-the library was pitch black and very eerie . [Harry]102-harry lit a lamp to see [his]102-harry way along the rows of books . The lamp looked as if it was floating along in midair , and even though [Harry]102-harry could feel [his]102-harry arm supporting it , the sight gave [him]102-harry the creeps . [The Restricted Section]1644-the restricted section was right at the back of [the library]663-the library . Stepping carefully over the rope that separated these books from the rest of [the library]663-the library , [he]102-harry held up [his]102-harry lamp to read the titles . [They]1690-they did n’t tell [him]102-harry much . [Their]1690-they peeling , faded gold letters spelled words in languages [Harry]102-harry could n’t understand . Some had no title at all . One book had a dark stain on it that looked horribly like blood . The hairs on the back of [Harry]102-harry ’s neck prickled . Maybe [he]102-harry was imagining it , maybe not , but [he]102-harry thought a faint whispering was coming from the books , as though [they]1690-they knew [someone]700-someone was there who should n’t be . [He]102-harry had to start somewhere . Setting the lamp down carefully on the floor , [he]102-harry looked along the bottom shelf for an interestinglooking book . A large black and silver volume caught [his]102-harry eye . [He]102-harry pulled it out with difficulty , because it was very heavy , and , balancing it on [his]102-harry knee , let it fall open . A piercing , bloodcurdling shriek split the silence — the book was screaming ! [Harry]102-harry snapped it shut , but the shriek went on and on , one high , unbroken , earsplitting note . [He]102-harry stumbled backward and knocked over [his]102-harry lamp , which went out at once . Panicking , [he]102-harry heard footsteps coming down [the corridor outside]1692-the corridor outside — stuffing the shrieking book back on the shelf , [he]102-harry ran for it . [He]102-harry passed [Filch]266-filch in the doorway ; [Filch]266-filch ’s pale , wild eyes looked straight through [him]102-harry , and [Harry]102-harry slipped under [Filch]266-filch ’s outstretched arm and streaked off up [the corridor]2732-the corridor , the book ’s shrieks still ringing in [his]102-harry ears . [He]102-harry came to a sudden halt in front of a tall suit of armor . [He]102-harry had been so busy getting away from [the library]663-the library , [he]102-harry had n’t paid attention to where [he]102-harry was going . Perhaps because it was dark , [he]102-harry did n’t recognize where [he]102-harry was at all . There was a suit of armor near [the kitchens]1695-the kitchens , [he]102-harry knew , but [he]102-harry must be five floors above there . “ [You]266-filch asked [me]102-harry to come directly to [you]266-filch , [Professor]2917-professor , if [anyone]372-anyone was wandering around at night , and [somebody]371-somebody ’s been in [the library Restricted Section]3156-the library restricted section . ”[102-harry] [Harry]102-harry felt the blood drain out of [his]102-harry face . [They]1696-they could n’t see [him]102-harry , of course , but it was [a narrow corridor]1697-a narrow corridor and if [they]1696-they came much nearer [they]1696-they ’d knock right into [him]102-harry — the cloak did n’t stop [him]102-harry from being solid . [He]102-harry backed away as quietly as [he]102-harry could . A door stood ajar to [his]102-harry left . It was [his]102-harry only hope . [He]102-harry squeezed through it , holding [his]102-harry breath , trying not to move it , and to [his]102-harry relief [he]102-harry managed to get inside [the room]510-the room without [their]1696-they noticing anything . [They]1696-they walked straight past , and [Harry]102-harry leaned against the wall , breathing deeply , listening to [their]1696-they footsteps dying away . That had been close , very close . It was a few seconds before [he]102-harry noticed anything about [the room [he]102-harry had hidden in]1699-the room he had hidden in . It looked like [an unused classroom]1700-an unused classroom . The dark shapes of desks and chairs were piled against the walls , and there was an upturned wastepaper basket — but propped against the wall facing [him]102-harry was something that did n’t look as if it belonged there , something that looked as if [someone]700-someone had just put it there to keep it out of the way . It was a magnificent mirror , as high as the ceiling , with an ornate gold frame , standing on two clawed feet . There was an inscription carved around the top : Erised stra ehru oyt ube cafru oyt on wohsi . [His]102-harry panic fading now that there was no sound of [Filch]266-filch and Snape , [Harry]102-harry moved nearer to the mirror , wanting to look at [himself]102-harry but see no reflection again . [He]102-harry stepped in front of it . [He]102-harry had to clap [his]102-harry hands to [his]102-harry mouth to stop [himself]102-harry from screaming . [He]102-harry whirled around . [His]102-harry heart was pounding far more furiously than when the book had screamed — for [he]102-harry had seen not only [himself]102-harry in the mirror , but [a whole crowd of people]1702-a whole crowd of people standing right behind [him]102-harry . But [the room]510-the room was empty . Breathing very fast , [he]102-harry turned slowly back to the mirror . There [he]102-harry was , reflected in it , white and scared looking , and there , reflected behind [him]102-harry , were at least [ten others]1704-ten others . [Harry]102-harry looked over [his]102-harry shoulder — but still , [no one]2238-no one was there . Or were [they]1704-ten others all invisible , too ? Was [he]102-harry in fact in [a room full of [invisible people]1707-invisible people]1706-a room full of invisible people and this mirror ’s trick was that it reflected [them]1704-ten others , invisible or not ? [He]102-harry looked in the mirror again . [A woman standing right behind [his]102-harry reflection]1708-a woman standing right behind his reflection was smiling at [him]102-harry and waving . [He]102-harry reached out a hand and felt the air behind [him]102-harry . If [she]1708-a woman standing right behind his reflection was really there , [he]102-harry ’d touch [her]1708-a woman standing right behind his reflection , [their]1709-their reflections were so close together , but [he]102-harry felt only air — [she]1708-a woman standing right behind his reflection and [the others]2493-the others existed only in the mirror . [She]1708-a woman standing right behind his reflection was [a very pretty woman]1711-a very pretty woman . [She]1708-a woman standing right behind his reflection had dark red hair and [her]1708-a woman standing right behind his reflection eyes — [her]1708-a woman standing right behind his reflection eyes are just like [mine]102-harry , [Harry]102-harry thought , edging a little closer to the glass . Bright green — exactly the same shape , but then [he]102-harry noticed that [she]1708-a woman standing right behind his reflection was crying ; smiling , but crying at the same time . [The tall , thin , black haired man]1712-the tall , thin , black haired man standing next to [her]1708-a woman standing right behind his reflection put [his]1712-the tall , thin , black haired man arm around [her]1708-a woman standing right behind his reflection . [He]1712-the tall , thin , black haired man wore glasses , and [his]1712-the tall , thin , black haired man hair was very untidy . It stuck up at the back , just as [Harry]102-harry ’s did . [Harry]102-harry was so close to the mirror now that [his]102-harry nose was nearly touching that of [his]102-harry reflection . “ [Mom]200-mom ? ”[102-harry] [he]102-harry whispered . “ [Dad]145-dad ? ”[102-harry] [They]1713-they just looked at [him]102-harry , smiling . And slowly , [Harry]102-harry looked into the faces of [the other people in the mirror]1714-the other people in the mirror , and saw other pairs of green eyes like [his]102-harry , other noses like [his]102-harry , even [a little old man who looked as though [he]1715-a little old man who looked as though he had harry ’s knobbly knees had [Harry]102-harry ’s knobbly knees]1715-a little old man who looked as though he had harry ’s knobbly knees — [Harry]102-harry was looking at [[his]102-harry family]1115-his family , for the first time in [his]102-harry life . [The Potters]99-the potters smiled and waved at [Harry]102-harry and [he]102-harry stared hungrily back at [them]99-the potters , [his]102-harry hands pressed flat against the glass as though [he]102-harry was hoping to fall right through it and reach them . [He]102-harry had a powerful kind of ache inside [him]102-harry , half joy , half terrible sadness . How long [he]102-harry stood there , [he]102-harry did n’t know . The reflections did not fade and [he]102-harry looked and looked until a distant noise brought [him]102-harry back to [his]102-harry senses . [He]102-harry could n’t stay here , [he]102-harry had to find [his]102-harry way back to bed . Look — read that , there . ”[195-ron] [She]216-hermione pushed the book toward [them]1767-you , and [Harry]102-harry and [Ron]195-ron read : The ancient study of alchemy is concerned with making the Sorcerer ’s Stone , a legendary substance with astonishing powers . The stone will transform any metal into pure gold . It also produces the Elixir of Life , which will make [the drinker immortal]1768-the drinker immortal . There have been many reports of [the Sorcerer]1769-the sorcerer ’s Stone over the centuries , but the only Stone currently in existence belongs to [Mr. Nicolas Flamel]210-flamel , [the noted alchemist and opera lover]1770-the noted alchemist and opera lover . [Mr. Flamel]210-flamel , who celebrated [his]210-flamel six hundred and sixty fifth birthday last year , enjoys a quiet life in [Devon]78-devon with [[his]210-flamel wife]444-his wife , [Perenelle]326-perenelle ( six hundred and fifty eight ) . “ See ? ”[216-hermione] said [Hermione]216-hermione , when [Harry]102-harry and [Ron]195-ron had finished . “ The dog must be guarding [[Flamel]210-flamel ’s Sorcerer ’s Stone]79-flamel ’s sorcerer ’s stone ! [Hagrid]119-hagrid had [Norbert]332-norbert packed and ready in a large crate . “ [He]332-norbert ’s got lots o ’ rats an ’ some brandy fer the journey , ”[119-hagrid] said [Hagrid]119-hagrid in a muffled voice . “ An ’ [I]119-hagrid ’ve packed [his]332-norbert teddy bear in case [he]332-norbert gets lonely . ”[119-hagrid] From inside the crate came ripping noises that sounded to [Harry]102-harry as though the teddy was having [his]332-norbert head torn off . “ Bye bye , [Norbert]332-norbert ! ”[119-hagrid] [Hagrid]119-hagrid sobbed , as [Harry]102-harry and [Hermione]216-hermione covered the crate with the Invisibility Cloak and stepped underneath it [themselves]1848-they . “ [Mommy]125-mommy will never forget [you]332-norbert ! ”[1848-they] How [they]1848-they managed to get the crate back up to [the castle]2806-the castle , [they]1848-they never knew . [Their]1939-they ears seemed sharper than usual . [Harry]102-harry ’s seemed to be picking up every sigh of the wind , every cracking twig . What was going on ? Where were [the others]2493-the others ? At last , a great crunching noise announced [Hagrid]119-hagrid ’s return . [Malfoy]221-malfoy , [Neville]196-neville , and [Fang]275-fang were with [him]196-neville . [Hagrid]119-hagrid was fuming . [Neville]196-neville had panicked and sent up the sparks . “[1010-you two] [We]1010-you two ’ll be lucky ter catch anythin ’ now , with the racket [you]1010-you two two were makin ’ . [I]0-i ’m sorry , ” [Hagrid]119-hagrid added in a whisper to [Harry]102-harry , “[0-i] but [he]1945-this idiot ’ll have a harder time frightenin ’ [you]102-harry , an ’ [we]1010-you two ’ve got ta get this done . ” So [Harry]102-harry set off into [the heart of [the forest]1242-the forest]3330-the heart of the forest with [Malfoy]221-malfoy and [Fang]275-fang . [They]1010-you two walked for nearly half an hour , deeper and deeper into [the forest]1242-the forest , until the path became almost impossible to follow because the trees were so thick . [Harry]102-harry thought the blood seemed to be getting thicker . There were splashes on the roots of a tree , as though the poor creature had been thrashing around in pain close by . [Harry]102-harry could see [a clearing ahead]1925-a clearing ahead , through the tangled branches of an ancient oak . “[1945-this idiot] Look — ” [he]102-harry murmured , holding out [his]102-harry arm to stop [Malfoy]221-malfoy . Something bright white was gleaming on the ground . [They]1010-you two inched closer . It was the unicorn all right , and it was dead . [Harry]102-harry had never seen anything so beautiful and sad . Its long , slender legs were stuck out at odd angles where it had fallen and its mane was spread pearly white on the dark leaves . [Harry]102-harry had taken one step toward it when a slithering sound made [him]102-harry freeze where [he]102-harry stood . A bush on [the edge of [the clearing]1802-the clearing]3334-the edge of the clearing quivered … Then , out of the shadows , a hooded figure came crawling across the ground like some stalking beast . [Harry]102-harry , [Malfoy]221-malfoy , and [Fang]275-fang stood transfixed . [The cloaked figure]3336-the cloaked figure reached the unicorn , lowered [its]3336-the cloaked figure head over the wound in the animal ’s side , and began to drink [its]3336-the cloaked figure blood . “[1945-this idiot] AAAAAAAAAARGH ! ” [Malfoy]221-malfoy let out a terrible scream and bolted — so did [Fang]275-fang . [The hooded figure]3337-the hooded figure raised [its]3337-the hooded figure head and looked right at [Harry]102-harry — unicorn blood was dribbling down [its]3337-the hooded figure front . [It]3337-the hooded figure got to [its]3337-the hooded figure feet and came swiftly toward [Harry]102-harry — [he]102-harry could n’t move for fear . Then a pain like [he]102-harry ’d never felt before pierced [his]102-harry head ; it was as though [his]102-harry scar were on fire . Half blinded , [he]102-harry staggered backward . [He]102-harry heard hooves behind [him]102-harry , galloping , and something jumped clean over [Harry]102-harry , charging at [the figure]1795-the figure . The pain in [Harry]102-harry ’s head was so bad [he]102-harry fell to [his]102-harry knees . It took a minute or two to pass . When [he]102-harry looked up , [the figure]1795-the figure had gone . [A centaur]3318-a centaur was standing over [him]102-harry , not [Ronan]341-ronan or [Bane]344-bane ; [this one]3341-this one looked younger ; [he]3341-this one had white blond hair and a palomino body . “[1945-this idiot] Are [you]1946-you all right ? ” said [the centaur]1929-the centaur , pulling [Harry]102-harry to [his]102-harry feet . “[1946-you] Yes — thank [you]1946-you — whatwas that ? ” [The centaur]1929-the centaur did n’t answer . [He]1929-the centaur had astonishingly blue eyes , like pale sapphires . [He]1929-the centaur looked carefully at [Harry]102-harry , [his]1929-the centaur eyes lingering on the scar that stood out , livid , on [Harry]102-harry ’s forehead . “[1946-you] [You]1946-you are [the Potter boy]1947-the potter boy , ” [he]1929-the centaur said . “[1946-you] [You]1946-you had better get back to [Hagrid]119-hagrid . [The forest]1242-the forest is not safe at this time — especially for [you]1946-you . Can [you]1946-you ride ? Have [we]3347-we not read what is to come in the movements of [the planets]1291-the planets ? ”[344-bane] [Ronan]341-ronan pawed the ground nervously . “I’m sure [Firenze]346-firenze thought [he]1947-the potter boy was acting for the best , ”[341-ronan] [he]341-ronan said in [his]341-ronan gloomy voice . [Bane]344-bane kicked [his]344-bane back legs in anger . “ For the best ! What is that to do with [us]3347-we ? [Centaurs]347-centaurs are concerned with what has been foretold ! It is not [our]3347-we business to run around like donkeys after [stray humans in [[our]3347-we forest]3351-our forest]3350-stray humans in our forest ! ”[344-bane] [Firenze]346-firenze suddenly reared on to [his]346-firenze hind legs in anger , so that [Harry]102-harry had to grab [his]346-firenze shoulders to stay on . “ Do [you]344-bane not see that unicorn ? ”[346-firenze] [Firenze]346-firenze bellowed at [Bane]344-bane . “ Do [you]344-bane not understand why it was killed ? Or have [the planets]1291-the planets not let [you]344-bane in on that secret ? [I]346-firenze set [myself]346-firenze against what is lurking in [this forest]3315-this forest , [Bane]344-bane , yes , with [humans]3354-humans alongside [me]346-firenze if [I]346-firenze must . ”[346-firenze] And [Firenze]346-firenze whisked around ; with [Harry]102-harry clutching on as best [he]102-harry could , [they]1953-they plunged off into the trees , leaving [Ronan]341-ronan and [Bane]344-bane behind [them]1953-they . [Harry]102-harry climbed over it and looked down through the trapdoor . There was no sign of the bottom . [He]102-harry lowered [himself]102-harry through the hole until [he]102-harry was hanging on by [his]102-harry fingertips . Then [he]102-harry looked up at [Ron]195-ron and said,“If anything happens to [me]102-harry , do n’t follow . [He]102-harry sat up and felt around , [his]102-harry eyes not used to the gloom . [She]216-hermione landed on [Harry]102-harry ’s other side . “ [We]3417-we must be miles under [the school]2389-the school , ”[216-hermione] [she]216-hermione said . “ Lucky this plant thing ’s here , really , ”[195-ron] said [Ron]195-ron . “ Lucky ! ”[216-hermione] shrieked [Hermione]216-hermione . “Look at [you]2021-their both ! ”[216-hermione] [She]216-hermione leapt up and struggled toward a damp wall . [She]216-hermione had to struggle because the moment [she]216-hermione had landed , the plant had started to twist snakelike tendrils around [her]216-hermione ankles . As for [Harry]102-harry and [Ron]195-ron , [their]2021-their legs had already been bound tightly in long creepers without [their]2021-their noticing . [Hermione]216-hermione had managed to free [herself]216-hermione before the plant got a firm grip on [her]216-hermione . Now [she]216-hermione watched in horror as [the two boys]2683-the two boys fought to pull the plant off [them]2683-the two boys , but the more [they]2683-the two boys strained against it , the tighter and faster the plant wound around [them]2683-the two boys . “ Stop moving ! ”[216-hermione] [Hermione]216-hermione ordered [them]2683-the two boys . “ [I]216-hermione know what this is — it ’s [Devil]355-devil ’s Snare ! ”[216-hermione] “ Oh , [I]195-ron ’m so glad [we]2683-the two boys know what it ’s called , that ’s a great help , ”[195-ron] snarled [Ron]195-ron , leaning back , trying to stop the plant from curling around [his]195-ron neck . “ Shut up , [I]216-hermione ’m trying to remember how to kill it ! ”[216-hermione] said [Hermione]216-hermione . “ Well , hurry up , [I]102-harry ca n’t breathe ! ”[102-harry] [Harry]102-harry gasped , wrestling with it as it curled around [his]102-harry chest . “ [Devil]355-devil ’s Snare , [Devil]355-devil ’s Snare … what did [Professor Sprout]268-professor sprout say?—it likes the dark and the damp — ”[102-harry] “ So light a fire ! ”[102-harry] [Harry]102-harry choked . “ Yes — of course — but there ’s no wood ! ”[102-harry] [Hermione]216-hermione cried , wringing [her]216-hermione hands . “ HAVE [YOU]2683-the two boys GONE MAD ? ”[195-ron] [Ron]195-ron bellowed . “ ARE [YOU]2683-the two boys [A WITCH OR NOT]3419-a witch or not ? ”[195-ron] “ Oh , right ! ”[216-hermione] said [Hermione]216-hermione , and [she]216-hermione whipped out [her]216-hermione wand , waved it , muttered something , and sent a jet of the same bluebell flames [she]216-hermione had used on [Snape]258-snape at the plant . Then [he]114-voldemort said,“Sir[2141-you] , there are some other things [I]0-i ’d like to know , if [you]2141-you can tell [me]0-i … things [I]0-i want to know the truth about … ” “[0-i] The truth . ” [Dumbledore]110-dumbledore sighed . “[0-i] It is a beautiful and terrible thing , and should therefore be treated with great caution . However , [I]0-i shall answer [your]2141-you questions unless [I]0-i have a very good reason not to , in which case [I]0-i beg [you]2141-you ’ll forgive [me]0-i .
